intro: Macaranga papuana var. glabristipulata, commonly known as the smooth-stippled macaranga, is a species of flowering plant in the Euphorbiaceae family. It is native to the Pacific islands, including Papua New Guinea and parts of Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are often smooth and glabrous on the upper surface. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers followed by capsule fruits that release seeds through a fleshy, explosive mechanism. This species is often found in moist, shaded habitats within tropical forests.
